spx.utils

Class Ticker

  • java.lang.Object
    • spx.utils.Ticker

  • public class Ticker
extends java.lang.Object
    The Ticker object represents a tick count in milliseconds since an unknown point.

    One ticker object can be compared with another using the getDiff methods.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Ticker()
      Creates a Ticker object set to now.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      long getDiff()
      Gets the difference between this ticker and now in milliseconds.
      long getDiff(Ticker other)
      Gets the difference between this ticker and another ticker in milliseconds.
      void setNow()
      Sets this Ticker to represent now.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Ticker

        public Ticker()
        Creates a Ticker object set to now.

    • Method Detail

      • getDiff

        public long getDiff(Ticker other)
        Gets the difference between this ticker and another ticker in milliseconds.
        Parameters:
        other - Another Ticker.
        Returns:
        Difference between tickers in milliseconds.
        Positive if the other Ticker is later than this Ticker, otherwise negative.

      • getDiff

        public long getDiff()
        Gets the difference between this ticker and now in milliseconds.
        Returns:
        Difference between ticker and now in milliseconds.
        Positive if this Ticker is in the past, otherwise negative.

      • setNow

        public void setNow()
        Sets this Ticker to represent now.
